JobFullDesc:
ActZero is a well-funded cybersecurity company entering hyper-growth mode. Our market leading, award-winning offering is a Managed Detection and Response (MDR) service that combines cybersecurity experts with sophisticated AI technology to protect our customers’ networks, clients, employees, and brands.

We’re a team of diverse and creative analysts, scientists, marketers, and engineers with a passion for cybersecurity. Our team has led cybersecurity at the White House, led NVIDIA’s cloud platform, created cloud-services at Amazon, and directed product for DARPA’s Foundational Cyber Warfare Program

As a Technical Account Manager, you will oversee thriving customer relationships as the customer’s guide to achieving exceptional security. You will serve as the customer’s trusted security advisor and function as an extension of their team, imparting technical and security guidance and best practices. You will learn to be the customer’s chief navigator, charting a path towards security maturity, mapping its journey and architecting a resilient posture. Further, as a customer advocate, your intimate knowledge and understanding of our customers will help shape the development of our cutting-edge technology and service. This role, while remote, is based around ActZero’s Seattle office.

While we’re a small and rapidly growing team, we have the stability and funding of a series B company. We believe in doing the best work of our careers in a collaborative environment supported by work-life balance, great benefits, a stable work environment, and building a culture led by our values.
As a Technical Account Manager, you will …

Oversee and maintain thriving customer relationships and handle escalations
Be the trusted technical security adviser to our customers, guiding them to achieve exceptional security
Facilitate customer onboarding; Architecting customer success plans and ensuring their achievement
Work cross-functionally to ensure customer needs are met
Assist our product development team to customize product requirements for customers based on service and product feedback
Develop collateral and documentation for internal and external use and consumption
We’d like to speak to you if you …

Have 5+ years of technical account management experience
Are a customer focused, data-driven, and process oriented professional with Windows systems administration experience
Bring a track record of success within a technical customer facing role
You work well in a fast-paced environment and face unique obstacles with positivity and integrity
You are committed to both professional development and business growth in a rapidly expanding market
Have the ability to deal with ambiguity, communicate well with partner teams, and a compassionate understanding of the customer experience
